intro: Lens esculenta var. himalayense, commonly known as the Himalayan lentil, is a variety of the common lentil native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It is a leguminous plant characterized by its small, lens-shaped seeds that are rich in protein and fiber. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces yellow flowers that develop into pods containing the edible seeds. It thrives in cool climates and well-drained soils, making it well-suited for cultivation in temperate regions. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and is often used in traditional cuisines across South Asia.
